projects.title: Rio de Janeiro Remastered
projects.description: Remake of the 2019 curated map, with greatly improved gameplay and visuals. My work was largely focused on optimisation, and assisting with direction, playtesting and ideation.

projects.title: StrongBadZone
projects.description: A recreation of StrongBadZone from Homestar Runner, Strong Bad Email #94. This was programmed in TypeScript using the Phaser 3 framework, and was my final project for CMPM 120 @ UCSC, Winter '25. The majority of art assets are 3D wireframe models.

projects.title: Fly-By
projects.description: A midterm project for CMPM 120 & UCSC, Winter '25. Fly-By is an Endless Runner where you pilot a paper airplane, weaving through an ever increasing volley of obstacles. This game used a custom physics routine modeled after Minecraft's Elytra physics.

projects.title: Back to the Frog
projects.description: Final project for an introductory game design & programming class & UCSC, made part-time in 3 weeks. This was my first foray into the Godot engine after a nearly 2 year long break from working on game programming. I wrote the entire codebase.

projects.title: Rio de Janeiro
projects.description: The original 2019 release of the curated unturned map. I assisted with development and became more involved towards the end of development, helping to push the map, which had been in development for years, across the finish line. Post-release I helped to support it with bug fixes, community support and optimisations.

projects.title: Christmas In July
projects.description: A christmas-themed entry to the community-hosted '2019 Summer MapJam'. Development was just under a month and intended to be played as a deathmatch map.
